title: Why can't millimeter waves pass obstacles? - Quora

response.answer_text: ‘In General’ electromagnetic waves are able to ‘pass’ objects that are smaller than the wavelength of the wave. ‘Diffraction’ of any wave is a major feature of this process. If you and a friend stand near the corner of a brick building, one on each side of the corner, you can experiment with the diffraction of sound waves. Stand near the wall and you will find that lower frequency sounds will ‘bend’ around the corner more readily than will higher frequency sounds.
